Package com.atakmap.map.opengl

Class GLMapView

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.atakmap.map.opengl.GLMapView
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AtakMapController.OnFocusPointChangedListener, AtakMapView.OnContinuousScrollEnabledChangedListener, AtakMapView.OnElevationExaggerationFactorChangedListener, AtakMapView.OnLayersChangedListener, AtakMapView.OnMapMovedListener, AtakMapView.OnMapProjectionChangedListener, MapRenderer, MapRenderer2, MapRenderer3, IMapRendererEnums, Disposable
    public class GLMapView
extends java.lang.Object
implements AtakMapView.OnMapMovedListener, AtakMapView.OnMapProjectionChangedListener, AtakMapView.OnLayersChangedListener, AtakMapView.OnElevationExaggerationFactorChangedListener, AtakMapView.OnContinuousScrollEnabledChangedListener, AtakMapController.OnFocusPointChangedListener, MapRenderer, MapRenderer3, Disposable
    OpenGL view implementation for AtakMapView. Unless otherwise noted, all methods should only be invoked on the GL context thread (see GLMapSurface.isGLThread() if you need to determine whether or not you are on the GL context thread). The values of public members should be considered read-only and only valid on the GL context thread.

      • scratch

        public final GLMapView.ScratchPad scratch
        A shared set of mutable objects that may be used by renderables in their draw method to avoid having to instantiate new objects for common rendering tasks like coordinate transformation. References to these objects should not be held.

      • continuousScrollEnabled

        public boolean continuousScrollEnabled

      • multiPartPass

        public boolean multiPartPass
        Flag indicating if the pass is being executed in multiple parts. If true, currentPass represents only part of the rendering pass. If false, there are no remaining parts to the rendering pass.

        All instances of currentPass that are parts for a given pass will share the same value for currentPass.renderPump, however, they may have different values for currentPass.drawVersion as the various parameters may be different (e.g. each part renders different regions of a large orthographic view).

      • currentPass

        public final GLMapView.State currentPass
        The state for the current pass. Scenes may be rendered in multiple passes, using different parameters and cameras.

      • currentScene

        public final GLMapView.State currentScene
        The scene that is the final render target.

        Start animating to a target Latitude, Longitude, and zoom level
        Parameters:
        lat - target latitude
        lng - target longitude
        scale - target map scale
        animateFactor - (0d, 1d] smoothness factor of snapping animation effect (0.3d is a good default)

      • lookFrom

        public boolean lookFrom​(GeoPoint from,
                        double azimuth,
                        double elevation,
                        boolean animate)
        Description copied from interface: MapRenderer2
        Looks from the specified location per the specified angles.
        Specified by:
        lookFrom in interface MapRenderer2
        azimuth - Rotation from north, clockwise in degrees
        elevation - Angle in degrees. Zero is horizontal to the tangent plane at the from location, greater than zero is upward with 90 straight up, less than zero is downward with -90 straight down

      • inverse

        public IMapRendererEnums.InverseResult inverse​(PointD xyz,
                                               GeoPoint lla,
                                               IMapRendererEnums.InverseMode mode,
                                               int hints,
                                               IMapRendererEnums.DisplayOrigin origin)
        Description copied from interface: MapRenderer2
        Transforms the specified view space coordinate into world space.
        Specified by:
        inverse in interface MapRenderer2
        Parameters:
        xyz - The view space location; xyz.z is ignored if mode is IMapRendererEnums.InverseMode.RayCast or
        lla - Returns the world location, per the specified mode
        mode - The inverse mode to be used, refer to IMapRendererEnums.InverseMode
        hints - The bitwise OR of any hints to be applied. See IMapRendererEnums.HINT_RAYCAST_IGNORE_SURFACE_MESH. IMapRendererEnums.HINT_RAYCAST_IGNORE_TERRAIN_MESH
        origin - The relative origin for the viewspace
        Returns:
        true if the coordinate was trasnformed, false> otherwise

      • getTerrainMeshElevation

        public double getTerrainMeshElevation​(double latitude,
                                      double longitude)
        Retrieves the mesh elevation, including offset and scaling, at the specified latitude and longitude.

        This method may ONLY be safely called from the GL thread.

        Parameters:
        latitude -
        longitude -
        Returns:
        The elevation value at the given latitude/longitude

      • getTerrainVersion

        public int getTerrainVersion()

      • forward

        public void forward​(java.nio.FloatBuffer src,
                    java.nio.FloatBuffer dst)
        Bulk geodetic to Open GL coordinate transformation method. This method is potentially MUCH more efficient when transforming more than one coordinate pair than any of the other forward methods. The src and dst objects may point to the same object.
        Parameters:
        src - The source coordinates, ordered as X, Y pairs (longitude, latitude).
        dst - The destination buffer for the open GL coordinates.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if src or dst are not direct, are not ordered by native endianness or do not return the same value for remaining().

      • forward

        public void forward​(java.nio.FloatBuffer src,
                    int srcSize,
                    java.nio.FloatBuffer dst,
                    int dstSize)
        Bulk geodetic to Open GL coordinate transformation method. This method is potentially MUCH more efficient when transforming more than one coordinate pair than any of the other forward methods. The src and dst objects may point to the same object.
        Parameters:
        src - The source coordinates, ordered as X, Y pairs (longitude, latitude).
        dst - The destination buffer for the open GL coordinates.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if src or dst are not direct, are not ordered by native endianness or do not return the same value for remaining().

      • forward

        public void forward​(java.nio.DoubleBuffer src,
                    java.nio.FloatBuffer dst)
        Bulk geodetic to Open GL coordinate transformation method. This method is potentially MUCH more efficient when transforming more than one coordinate pair than any of the other forward methods. The src and dst objects may point to the same object.
        Parameters:
        src - The source coordinates, ordered as X, Y pairs (longitude, latitude).
        dst - The destination buffer for the open GL coordinates.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if src or dst are not direct, are not ordered by native endianness or do not return the same value for remaining().

        public void forward​(java.nio.DoubleBuffer src,
                    int srcSize,
                    java.nio.FloatBuffer dst,
                    int dstSize)
        Bulk geodetic to Open GL coordinate transformation method. This method is potentially MUCH more efficient when transforming more than one coordinate pair than any of the other forward methods. The src and dst objects may point to the same object.
        Parameters:
        src - The source coordinates, ordered as X, Y pairs (longitude, latitude).
        dst - The destination buffer for the open GL coordinates.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if src or dst are not direct, are not ordered by native endianness or do not return the same value for remaining().

      • getControl

        public <T> T getControl​(java.lang.Class<T> ctrlClazz)
        Description copied from interface: MapRenderer3
        Retrives the specified renderer control. Renderer controls are valid for the lifetime of the associated renderer.

        Note that renderer controls may also be obtained via the various visitControls(...) methods by specifying a null Layer.

        Specified by:
        getControl in interface MapRenderer3
        Parameters:
        ctrlClazz - The control type
        Returns:
        The renderer control, or null if the renderer does not have a control of the specified type.
